repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits

summary.p: This manuscript contains a ballad (ammāṉai) on the Catholic saint Margaret, called in Tamil Marikarutammāḷ. It tells the story of her life, conversion to Christianity, and death. The author is unknown, but the text likely dates to the 18th century.
The manuscript is fairly simple: it is constituted by one unit single unit containing the (incomplete) text and several blank but numbered folios.
Description by M. Trento based on the examination of the original manuscript.

filiation.p: This texts exists in multiple manuscript and printed versions (see the bibliography below for some of the printed editions).

supportDesc.foliation: Original left-marginal Tamil numerals foliation. Several foliation numbers corrected.

collation.desc: The front cover has a sticker of the BnF with the current shelfmark (Indien 486). The back cover has on the inside some numbers in white chalk: 66 bis 46 3

33 folios = Marikarutammāḷ Ammāṉai. Tamil foliation 1-33. f28-f33 blank. f1-f18 are foliated, inscribed and inked; f19-f27 are foliated, inscribed but not inked; f28-f33 are foliated but otherwise blank.

supportDesc.condition: Overall good conditions; signs of humidity; f25 is chipped.

handNote.desc: Partially inked. The same scribe seems to have copied the entire manuscript. He sometimes used the double-curled kompu for long vowels ō and ē, but more often they remain unmarked.

additions.desc: Shelfmark in black ink: nº 24 (folio 1r). This is the shelfmark given according to the list of manuscript compiled by Velanguani Arokium (Vēḷāṅkaṉṉi Ārōkkiyam) (NAF 5443, folio 4r).
Arabic foliation 27 added in black ink (f27r).
The scribe corrected the page number on several instances (for instance, on f17, f19, f20).
BnF current shelfmark sticker: INDIEN 486 (front cover, recto).

binding.p: Pinewood covers apparently fabricated in the BnF.

origin.origDate: No internal date. Dated to circa 1830 by Vinson in Vinson et al. (1866-) and to 1830 by Cabaton (1912), on unstated grounds (presumably palaeographical and material analysis arguments). The ms. is not dated, but since it was included in the hand-written list that Velanguani Arokium (Vēḷāṅkaṉṉi Ārōkkiyam) compiled in 1845, we know this is the date ante quem it arrived in Paris.

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.
